N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 ยง 411.4 - Time for filing a bond, depositing acceptable security and increasing the amounts thereof

State Regulations

Tax Law, ยง 283(3), (6)
(a) An applicant for registration as a
distributor of motor fuel will not be registered until such applicant files a
bond or deposits acceptable security with the Department of Taxation and

Finance in such amount as the department may require. (b) The department may require that the
amount of a bond or the amount of deposited security be increased at any time
when in its judgment such increase is necessary as a protection to the revenues
under article 12-A of the Tax Law and articles 28 and 29 of such law. Such
increase must be filed within 30 days from the date of the notice and demand
therefor. An accelerated hearing, pursuant to section
283 (6)(b)(ii)
of the Tax

Law, to review an increase in the amount of a bond or other security will be
accorded a distributor, provided a petition for such review is filed within
seven days of the date of the notice and demand for such increase. (See Part
3000 of this Title for hearing procedures.)
